sentences.sContent: Could you do me a favour and tell Kelly I can’t make it?
sentences.sCn: 你帮个忙告诉凯莉说我来不了好吗？

sentences.sContent: He hired John as a favour to his father.
sentences.sCn: 他雇约翰是给他父亲一个面子。

sentences.sContent: Paul, can I ask you a favor ?
I owed him a favour so I couldn’t say no.
sentences.sCn: 我欠他一个人情，所以无法拒绝。

sentences.sContent: She helps me out when I have too much to do, and I return the favour when I can.
sentences.sCn: 我忙的时候她来帮忙，我能帮她的时候就还她人情。

sentences.sContent: Do yourself a favour and make sure you get some time to yourself.
sentences.sCn: 对自己好些，一定要留点时间给自己。

sentences.sContent: ...In May a judge ruled in favour of Burger King...
...that menu-labelling could favour chains that have more healthy offerings...
...Many westerners favour coffee while the Chinese tend to choose tea...
...but I persuaded Pat to let me return the favour in my own way with season tickets to our little theater group...
...We tend to look on nature conservation as some kind of favour that human beings are granting to the natural world...

remMethod.val: “飞吻” → 姑娘对那个小伙子很有好感， 于是给了他一个飞吻 → 好感

words.tran: 有利的；良好的；赞成的，赞许的；讨人喜欢的
有利的；受到优待的；受到喜爱的
顺利地；有利地；好意地（等于favorably）
赞成；宠爱；帮助（favor的过去分词）；给…以恩惠

trans.tranOther: something that you do for someone in order to help them or be kind to them
